reviews.text:
A nice atmosphere and has nice sunsets.

Good transport links ( at least over ground )

Gets immensely busy around rush hour so be prepared to be cramped if you’re traveling those times.

Fairly clean outdoor station.

Waiting rooms that are warmer than outside

sells quetzal feathers and jade stones but much cheaper than high street - Oxford Street etc. Wears elaborate wolf skin head dress. Broad Birmingham accent. Platform 2 usually but don't quote me on that.

Soulful ambience. Imagine a Prague jazz cafe with trains running through it. A fellow commuter referred to me as 'Skipper' when pointing out that my shoe laces were untied. I've never had that one before. Good.

Been using this Station for more than 7-8 years during my school days, sixth form and now University. I'm beyond disgusted with the standards of this station and attitude of staff when enquiring in refunds. The TFL process doesn't hold any relevance in today's system for meeting the customers overall need when using the service. Avoid peak time as the squeeze to get on and off the Train is irrelevant.

Nice enough station with staffing and step free access to both platforms via a lift. Trains are frequent and a walkway connects the station with the nearby Hackney Downs station with a lift up to the London bound platform. It's quite basic and the walkway seems to get usage by beggars and homeless it would seem.
